page.title: 04Farming in the Mark area
page.content: In Mark,the longest village in Somerset,possibly in the country,there is a thriving{farming}community. There are around 25 to 30 farms mainly dairy.The average farm size would be about 150 acres <60 hectares> of which about 100 acres would be{grassland used for grazing,silage and hay for the winter feeding-not for sale. A typical{herd}in this area would be 20-25{Friesians}with 40 "followers" i.e.20 home-reared calves and 20 yearlings. Silage-making has increased over the last decade as it is more economical than hay to produce. On farms of this size it makes sense to share expensive{machinery}such as combine harvesters,balers etc. A familiar sight around the country lanes is the blue and white milk tanker collecting{milk}once daily .
